title: Hal McKusick / Now's the Time / Decca 1957 / Bill Evans, Art Far
description:
As McKusick recalls it: "George Russell was a great influence on all the guys in the

workshop.  His writing led us in a variety of new directions-harmonically.  His 

pieces/lines were not easy to play.  We sightread them.  Then we had to woodshed the 

things.  They didn't lie comfortably on the instruments.  We had to spend time

refining and sharpening our approach to each work.  Barry and I even took time out to

study with George for a while in order to more fully understand what he was doing.  

George's stuff was an adventure.  You honed your skills as a musician playing this

material.  It moved us ahead-technically and aesthetically."  (from text)





All I know is that if Bill Evans is involved, I will likely love the record...fA
